recipe.name: Tipsy Shrimp (or other white meat)
recipe.notes:
The original recipe called for cognac but this is completely serviceable with just brandy. Don't let the minimalist ingredient list fool you, this is a reasonable deal.
I found the end result a little watery: might not be a bad idea to cook the sauce down a bit (reserving the shrimp) for a more savory gravy.
recipe.preparation: Saute shrimp or other meat in butter for 4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Add liquor and condionally ignite vapors with long match/lighter (yay! flames!) and serve.
recipe.source_name: "A Book Of Appetizers, Shrimps and Things in Cognac, Helen Evans Brown
